section.title: Installation (Windows)
section.para: Install EiffelStudio 5.7 and remember which C Compiler you use (Borland Compiler or Microsoft Visual Studio Compiler), since you will need this for the EiffelMedia installation. EiffelMedia 0.8.1 comes with an installer. According to your choice above (Microsoft or Borland Compiler) use the installer em_msc_0.8.1.exe (for Microsoft compiler) or em_bcb_0.8.1.exe (for Borland compiler). Follow the onscreen instructions.
section.title: Installation (Linux)
section.para: Install EiffelStudio 5.7 according to their installation instructions. EiffelMedia 0.8.1 needs to be built from source. Download em_0.8.1_src.tar.gzip and follow the instructions provided with the release. Note that you will need gobo and ewg cvs head versions to make EiffelMedia work.
section.title: Traffic 3.1
section.para: Traffic does not need to be installed, just download the zip-file and unzip it to a directory of your choice. The applications such as Flat Hunt and City3D are located in the respective directory under traffic/example (e.g. traffic/example/flat_hunt). To get it to run, however, you'll have to compile it first.
For that you have to complete the following steps:

listitem.para: Click on "File ->Open Project..." and click on "Add project" (see Figure 1). This will open file dialog in which you choose the *.ecf file of the application you wish to compile. Click on "Open". This will compile the application.
Once the project is compiled you can execute it by clicking on the "Debug" button in EiffelStudio or by hitting F5.

para.emphasis: Now you have compiled your first application. Enjoy...
